docs.lead_paragraph: Along with skiing and partying into the night, Europe-bashing has long been a favorite sport whenever the world's business and political elite gather in Davos, Switzerland, for their once-a-year winter schmoozefest.

headline.main: Europe's Welfare System Gets New Attention

docs.abstract: Could Europe's much-reviled social welfare system actually end up being the model for the 21st-century world? That was a question in the Alpine air as attendees gathered for this year's World Economic Forum.

docs.lead_paragraph: The financial giant Bank of America says it is no longer lobbying the federal government about its unfolding bank bailout. After receiving $45 billion in bailout money, lobbying was just too unseemly.

headline.main: Firms That Got Bailout Money Keep Lobbying

docs.abstract: The financial giant Bank of America says it is no longer lobbying the federal government about its unfolding bank bailout. After receiving $45 billion in bailout money, lobbying was just too unseemly. docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama and his top advisers sought over the weekend to broaden the appeal of his proposed $825 billion economic-stimulus package.

headline.print_headline: White House Pushing Stimulus Package While Tightening Regulatory System

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama and his top advisers sought over the weekend to broaden the appeal of his proposed $825 billion economic-stimulus package.

byline.original: By BRIAN KNOWLTON and PETER BAKER

docs.lead_paragraph: As the Obama administration tackles the challenge of shoring up the economy through infusions of capital and job creation, cultural leaders are urging the president not to forget arts institutions, which are also reeling from the market downturn. ''We wanted to make sure arts were not left out of the recovery,'' said Robert L. Lynch, president of Americans for the Arts, a national lobbying group. ''The artist's paycheck is every bit as important as the steelworker's paycheck or the autoworker's paycheck.''
